books.title: The Iliad
books.author: Homer
books.summary: The epic poem which follows a Greek warrior who refuses to give up his prize of war.

books.title: Tarzan and the Ant Men
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: The legendary lord of the jungle Tarzan finds himself trapped in an unfamiliar land inhabited by a tiny people.

books.title: Memoirs of a Foxhunting Man
books.author: Siegfried Sassoon
books.summary: A young boy comes of age in the idyllic English countryside just before the Great War tears Europe apart.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: Little Lord Fauntleroy
books.author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
books.summary: A poor young boy unexpectedly inherits a peerage and travels to England to live with his grandfather, an Earl.

books.title: Arms and the Man
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A humorous examination of human hypocrisy and war’s stupidity in the midst of the Serbo-Bulgarian war.

books.title: Philoctetes
books.author: Sophocles
books.summary: A wounded warrior, abandoned on a deserted island, is visited by former comrades who ask for his help in winning a war.

books.title: The Master Mind of Mars
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A new hero from Earth reaches Mars and battles a merchant of purloined youth.

books.title: Béatrix
books.author: Honoré de Balzac
books.summary: A young man falls for an older woman, who introduces him to a friend in order to distract him.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: The complete U.S. public domain short fiction of horror legend H. P. Lovecraft.

books.title: Seven Pillars of Wisdom
books.author: T. E. Lawrence
books.summary: T. E. Lawrence’s memoir of leading the Arab revolt against the Ottoman empire during World War I.

books.title: A Bid for Fortune
books.author: Guy Boothby
books.summary: A young Australian man struggles to reclaim his love from the clutches of an evil mastermind.

books.title: Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
books.author: Thomas De Quincey
books.summary: A portrait of the life of a drug addict in Georgian-era London.

books.title: Darkwater
books.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
books.summary: A collection of essays, short fiction, and poetry related to the lives of black people in Jim Crow-era America.

books.title: Songs of the Cattle Trail and Cow Camp
books.author: John A. Lomax
books.summary: A collection of cowboy poetry collected by folklorist John A. Lomax.

books.title: The Little Nugget
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: The ambitious fiancée of an English gentleman asks him to kidnap the son of an American businessman from boarding school, before professional kidnappers get to him first.

books.title: The House on the Borderland
books.author: William Hope Hodgson
books.summary: An account of the terrifying metaphysical haunting of a recluse’s secluded home.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Thomas Hardy
books.summary: A collection of Thomas Hardy’s short stories, mostly ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.
